title: [K-12] Game-based Exploration of Mathematical Abstraction: Symmetry and Creative Problem-solving

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of Basic Mathematical Concepts and Experience in Digital Game Manipulation
context.additional_context: Blended learning combining online gaming environments and offline workshops. Learners use personal devices to experience creative problem-solving in virtual spaces and autonomously explore mathematical principles.

learning_goals: Strategic tools (artefact-strategy) for solving symmetry problems in game environments are designed, and the ability to apply them is evaluated.
Mathematical abstractions occurring during gameplay are documented and explained by connecting them to scientific concepts.

Learners will form teams of 3â€“4 members, select one observed phenomenon from daily life (e.g., bicycle speed, plant growth), and produce a report with visual aids that outlines a three-stage process (observation-hypothesis-modeling) to convert it into a mathematical model (graphs, equations, etc.) for presentation.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
